location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.284 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter concerns questions of responsibility on the part of Muhammed bin Khalifa of Bahrain, for breaches of the maritime peace committed by tribes on the Guttur [Qatar] coast. The letter encloses a translation of a letter sent by Sheikh Mahomed beh Khuleefa [Muhammed bin Khalifa] to Kemball (undated, folios 58-59), who informs him that he has paid the fine as demanded to Commodore Robinson, and asks that Kemball punish the people of Guttur [Qatar] directly for their breaches of the maritime peace in future. Kemball also encloses his reply to Muhammad bin Khalifa (folios 59-6), dated 21 September 1853.
